description.en: Learn to use 'any more' with negative verbs to express 'ya no...' (no longer). Always place 'any more' at the end of the sentence.
description.es: Aprende a usar 'any more' con verbos negativos para expresar 'ya no...' (no longer). Siempre coloca 'any more' al final de la frase.

prompt.en: I don't play sport any more.

exercises.solution: I don't play sport any more.

tip.en: 'Any more' with negative verbs means 'ya no...' (no longer). Always place it at the END of the sentence, regardless of verb type.
tip.es: 'Any more' con verbos negativos significa 'ya no...' (no longer). Siempre colócalo al FINAL de la frase, sin importar el tipo de verbo.

prompt.en: I don't go to school any more.

exercises.solution: I don't go to school any more.

tip.en: 'Any more' with negative verbs means 'ya no...' (no longer). Always place it at the END of the sentence, regardless of verb type.
tip.es: 'Any more' con verbos negativos significa 'ya no...' (no longer). Siempre colócalo al FINAL de la frase, sin importar el tipo de verbo.

prompt.es: Ya no creo en la perfección.

exercises.solution: I don't believe in perfection any more.

tip.en: 'Any more' with negative verbs means 'ya no...' (no longer). Always place it at the END of the sentence, regardless of verb type.
tip.es: 'Any more' con verbos negativos significa 'ya no...' (no longer). Siempre colócalo al FINAL de la frase, sin importar el tipo de verbo.

prompt.es: Ya no te puedes fiar de ella.

exercises.solution: You can't trust her any more.

tip.en: Even with auxiliary verbs (can't, won't, shouldn't), 'any more' still goes at the END of the sentence. The position never changes.
tip.es: Incluso con verbos auxiliares (can't, won't, shouldn't), 'any more' sigue yendo al FINAL de la frase. La posición nunca cambia.
